Unnamed: 4: The Argentinian bolognese is differentiated from the Italian only by cubed beef.
unknown cookbook from resource center with input from native agentinian, Mariano.

Unnamed: 0: As it appears above, recipe yields how many servings?

Cube beef into 1/2 inch pieces.  Set aside.  Heat the butter and oil in a heavy saucepan.  Add the onion and cook over moderate heat until translucent.  Stir in the carrot, celery and garlic, cook for about 5 minutes.  Add the beef into the vegetables, stir until the meat loses its red color.  Season with salt and pepper.  Pour in the wine, raise the heat slightly and cook until reduced by more than half.  Add the milk tomatoes in their own juice and the herbs.  Bring the sauce to a boil.  Reduce the heat to low and simmer uncovered for 1 1/2 to 2 hours, stirring occaisionally.  Add sugar and balsamic vinagre.  Correct the seasoning before serving.
